storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to generate attendance reports to achieve accurate tracking of employee presence and absences

testCases.title: Generate attendance report with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected date range
Time-tracking system is integrated and operational
At least one department exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options including date range, department, and employee selectors

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., last 30 days) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the filter field without validation errors

steps.action: Select a department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and displayed in the filter field without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to submit the report generation request
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed on screen within 5 seconds showing employee names, timestamps, attendance status, and summary statistics

postconditions: Attendance report is displayed with accurate data matching the applied filters
Report generation is logged in the system audit trail
User remains on the Attendance Reporting page with filters intact

testCases.title: Export attendance report to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance report has been successfully generated with valid filters
Report data is displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads

steps.action: Generate attendance report by selecting date range and department filters, then clicking 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed on screen with complete attendance data including timestamps, employee details, and attendance status

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'Attendance_Report_[DateRange].pdf' containing all report data with proper formatting, headers, and absenteeism highlights

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and displays all report data accurately matching the on-screen report

steps.action: Return to the attendance report screen and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'Attendance_Report_[DateRange].xlsx' containing all report data in spreadsheet format

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with properly formatted columns, headers, and all attendance data matching the on-screen report

postconditions: Both PDF and Excel files are successfully downloaded and saved
Export actions are logged in the system audit trail
User remains on the Attendance Reporting page
Original report remains displayed on screen

testCases.title: Verify absenteeism highlights in attendance report
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module
Attendance data exists with known absenteeism and punctuality issues
Time-tracking system is integrated and contains source data
Test department has employees with documented absences and late arrivals

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section and select a department known to have absenteeism issues
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options

steps.action: Select date range covering the period with known absenteeism and click 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with complete attendance data including employee names, dates, timestamps, and attendance status

steps.action: Review the report for visual indicators of absenteeism trends such as color coding, icons, or highlighted rows
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism trends are clearly indicated with visual highlights (e.g., red indicators for absences, yellow for late arrivals) and summary statistics showing absenteeism patterns

steps.action: Review the report for punctuality issue indicators
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality issues are clearly marked with distinct visual indicators showing late arrivals and their frequency

steps.action: Cross-reference report data with source data from the time-tracking system
steps.expectedResult: Report data matches source data with 98% accuracy including timestamps, attendance status, and employee records

steps.action: Verify that absenteeism percentage calculations are correct
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism percentages and statistics are calculated correctly based on the attendance data

postconditions: Absenteeism and punctuality issues are accurately identified and highlighted
Report data accuracy is verified against source system
User has confidence in report reliability
Report remains available for export or further analysis

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to highlight absenteeism trends in attendance reports to achieve proactive workforce management

testCases.title: Verify absenteeism trend highlighting in attendance report
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to Attendance Reporting module with trend analysis
Attendance data exists with identifiable absenteeism patterns
Trend analysis algorithm is configured and operational
Test data includes multiple employees with varying absenteeism patterns

steps.action: Navigate to Attendance Reporting section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options and trend analysis features enabled

steps.action: Select a time period filter (e.g., last 3 months) using the date range picker
steps.expectedResult: Time period is selected and displayed in the filter field without validation errors

steps.action: Select a department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button to request report with trend analysis
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated within 5 seconds and displayed with attendance data and absenteeism trend analysis

steps.action: Review the report for visual absenteeism trend highlights such as graphs, charts, color-coded patterns, or trend indicators
steps.expectedResult: Absenteeism trends are clearly indicated visually with graphical representations (e.g., trend lines, heat maps, or highlighted patterns) showing patterns over the selected time period

steps.action: Verify that trend highlights include metrics such as increasing/decreasing absenteeism, peak absence periods, and repeat offenders
steps.expectedResult: Trend analysis displays comprehensive metrics including absenteeism rate changes, peak absence days/periods, and employees with recurring absences

steps.action: Click 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded containing the report with all absenteeism trend highlights, graphs, and visual indicators intact

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF and verify trend highlights are preserved
steps.expectedResult: PDF displays all absenteeism trend highlights including charts, color coding, and visual indicators exactly as shown in the on-screen report

steps.action: Return to report screen and click 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded containing the report data with absenteeism trend indicators and supporting data

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file and verify trend data is included
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains all trend data, calculations, and conditional formatting to represent absenteeism highlights

postconditions: Absenteeism trends are accurately detected and highlighted with 90% accuracy
Exported reports (PDF and Excel) contain all trend highlights
Export actions are logged in the system audit trail
User can take proactive workforce management actions based on identified trends
Report data is available for further analysis

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to export attendance reports in PDF format to achieve easy sharing and printing

testCases.title: Export attendance report to PDF
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Manager role
User has authorization to access attendance reports
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected period
Browser supports PDF file downloads
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page is displayed with report generation options

steps.action: Select the desired date range for the attendance report (e.g., current month)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and highlighted in the date picker

steps.action: Select department or employee filters if needed
steps.expectedResult: Selected filters are applied and displayed

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed on screen with all attendance data including employee names, dates, check-in/check-out times, and status

steps.action: Verify the report data is accurate and complete on screen
steps.expectedResult: Report displays correct attendance information matching the selected criteria

steps.action: Click on 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF export process initiates, loading indicator appears, and export completes within 5 seconds

steps.action: Observe the browser download notification or downloads folder
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is successfully downloaded with a meaningful filename (e.g., 'Attendance_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf')

steps.action: Navigate to the downloads folder and locate the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is present in the downloads folder with correct file size (not 0 KB)

steps.action: Open the PDF file using a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully without errors

steps.action: Verify the PDF contains all attendance data from the generated report
steps.expectedResult: PDF displays complete attendance data including all employee records, dates, times, and status information

steps.action: Check the formatting and readability of the PDF document
steps.expectedResult: PDF maintains proper formatting with clear headers, aligned columns, readable fonts, proper spacing, and professional layout

steps.action: Verify PDF includes report metadata (generation date, date range, filters applied)
steps.expectedResult: PDF header or footer contains report generation timestamp and selected criteria

steps.action: Test PDF printability by sending to printer or print preview
steps.expectedResult: PDF is print-ready with proper page breaks and margins

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and saved to local system
PDF file contains accurate and complete attendance data
PDF maintains formatting and is readable
Original report remains displayed on screen
User session remains active
Export action is logged in system audit trail
